numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The graph shows a relation between admission chances and income percentile.
3. Some colleges claim that legacy status does not matter for admission.
4. The graph shows that being a legacy applicant increases the chance of admission to an elite college.
5. The graph shows that being in the top 1% of income increases the chance of admission to an elite college.
6. The graph shows that the chance of admission increases sharply around the 90th income percentile.
7. The 90th income percentile is the top 10% of income.
8. The graph shows that the increase is stronger for legacy applicants.
9. I wonder whether colleges will ever not take legacy status into account.
10. I want colleges to give everyone equal opportunities.
11. Equal opportunities should not depend on whether a family attended the school.
12. This situation relates to me and my community.
13. This situation means that we have a lower chance of admission to high-end colleges than a legacy applicant.
14. This situation means that we have a lower chance of admission to high-end colleges than a very rich applicant.
15. The headline could be: Data shows that elite colleges that preach equity still favor legacies and the upper class.
